author: rstolpe
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

Supported version of PS 7 to Windows 11 ARM

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: There is already Windows ARM distributive. Have you any problems with it?

comments.author: rstolpe
comments.body:
> There is already Windows ARM distributive. Have you any problems with it?
> 
> 

Where so I download it then? I can only find the x64 one

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Ah, you ask about ARM32. PowerShell 7 follows .Net support https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/main/release-notes/6.0/supported-os.md. Current public .Net 6.0 hasn't ARM32 support on Windows.
GitHub
core/supported-os.md at main · dotnet/core
Home repository for .NET Core. Contribute to dotnet/core development by creating an account on GitHub.

comments.author: MartinGC94
comments.body:
No I think he is asking about 64 bit ARM, he just can't find it because the table on the readme page doesn't have them.  
@rstolpe you need to look under releases: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases you can find all download links under "assets" under each release. Look for `win-arm64.zip` to find it.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.
